intro: Phacelia hirsuta, commonly known as woolly phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Phacelia hirsuta is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
